clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Daily Stair Walking on Cardiovascular Health
clinical_study.official_title: Danish: Integreret Motion på Arbejdspladsen (IRMA) English: Implementation of Exercise at the Workplace

lead_sponsor.agency: National Research Centre for the Working Environment, Denmark

clinical_study.source: National Research Centre for the Working Environment, Denmark

brief_summary.textblock:
Many adults find it difficult to perform physical exercise during leisure. The workplace may provide an optimal setting to encourage a healthier lifestyle. This study investigates the effect of daily stair walking at the workplace on cardiovascular health.
The main hypothesis is that daily stair walking for 10 weeks compared with a control group results in increased aerobic fitness.

primary_outcome.time_frame: before and after the 10 week intervention
primary_outcome.description: Watt-max test on a Monark bicycle ergometer

before and after the 10 week intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the 10 week intervention

arm_group.description: Participants of this group is encouraged to use the stairs for 10 minutes a day at the workplace
Receives a health examination before and after the intervention period, and are advised to stay active

intervention.description: Participants of the stair group is encouraged to use the stairs for 10 minutes a day at the workplace. Participants of the control group receive a health examination before and after the intervention period, and are advised to stay active
